articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Democratic Senator Chris Van Hollen arrived in El Salvador on Wednesday morning saying he would seek to meet with senior officials from the Central American country to secure the release of Kilmar Abrego Garcia, a Salvadoran man mistakenly deported and being held in a notorious prison.
articles.title: US senator lands in El Salvador seeking release of wrongly deported Salvadoran man

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A U.S. federal judge on Wednesday found "probable cause" to hold President Donald Trump's administration in contempt of court for violating his order last month halting deportations of Venezuelan migrants under a wartime law.
articles.title: Judge says probable cause for criminal contempt by Trump administration in Venezuelan deportations

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Gaza has become a "mass grave" for Palestinians and those trying to help them, medical charity MSF said on Wednesday, as medics said the Israeli military killed at least 13 in the north of the enclave and continued to demolish homes in Rafah in the south.
articles.title: Gaza a 'mass grave' of Palestinians, says MSF, as Israeli strikes kill 13

articles.author: Phil Stewart, Idrees Ali
articles.description: A Pentagon investigation into leaks of classified and sensitive information has expanded to include two more aides to Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth and his deputy, officials said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Pentagon leak probe expands as two more officials put on leave

articles.author: Sam Tobin, Michael Holden
articles.description: The United Kingdom's top court on Wednesday upheld an appeal by a campaign group on whether transgender women are legally women under equality legislation, ruling that the law referred to a "biological woman and biological sex".
articles.title: UK Supreme Court says 'woman' refers to biological sex under equality laws

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Lebanese army said on Wednesday it had detained a number of Palestinians and Lebanese suspected of involvement in two attacks from the country on Israel in March and did not mention Iran-backed Hezbollah, which has denied any role.
articles.title: Lebanese army says it detained suspects in March attacks on Israel, no mention of Hezbollah

articles.author: Daphne Psaledakis
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio said on Wednesday he was shutting down a State Department office that had sought to counter foreign disinformation, accusing it of censorship and wasting U.S. taxpayer money.
articles.title: US State Department closing office aimed at countering foreign disinformation

articles.author: David Ljunggren
articles.description: Prime Minister Mark Carney clashed with his chief rival for the first time during Canada's election campaign on Wednesday, in a French-language debate that could help determine who wins the April 28 vote and then deals with U.S. tariffs.
articles.title: Carney clashes with chief rival for first time during Canada debate

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Donald Trump's administration intends to appeal a judge's ruling allowing U.S. officials to face questioning over the steps taken to secure the return of a man wrongly deported to El Salvador, a court filing showed on Wednesday.
articles.title: Trump administration to challenge order for testimony about wrongly deported man

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korea criticised the United States for deploying the B-1B strategic bomber in a recent joint military drill with South Korea, state media KCNA reported on Thursday.
articles.title: North Korea criticises US for deploying B-1B strategic bomber in South Korea
